intro: Lotononis parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
